data.meta_description: The primary function of the Chancellor of the Diocesan Curia is to ensure that the acts of the curia are gathered, arranged, and safeguarded in the curial archives (canon 482, ยง1). He also serves as a chief notary of the diocese (canon 482, ยง3).

Office of the Chancellor

>

Office of the Chancellor & Diocesan Archives

The primary function of the Chancellor of the Diocesan Curia is to ensure that the acts of the curia are gathered, arranged, and safeguarded in the curial archives (canon 482, ยง1). He also serves as a chief notary of the diocese (canon 482, ยง3).

For Tribunal/Canon Law issues, please click here for The Diocesan Tribunal and Canonical Affairs Office

Deacon Keith Cabiles, Chancellor

Email Keith Cabiles

(808) 585-3385

Diocese of Honolulu

1184 Bishop St.

Honolulu, Hawaii 96813

Lea Barcelona, Assistant

Email Lea Barcelona

(808) 203-6715

St. Stephen Diocesan Center

The Chancellor's Office prepares and implements our diocese's national and approved special Second Collections.

Click here for 2025 List

Click here for 2024 List

The Chancellor's Office prepares statistical and data reports for our diocese, such as

The October Mass Counts (Click here for the 2023 form),

The Official Catholic Directory,

The Annual Parish Stats Worksheet , and the

Annual Diocesan Report to the Apostolic Signatura.

Other forms and documents:

RCIA Pre-Initiation Inventory

Affidavit in Lieu of Baptismal Certificate

For use when it is impossible to provide a baptismal certificate

Sacramental Register Instruction
